content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:

do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: These $140 earbuds translate 50+ languages while you listen
entries.snippet: The Mymanu Orb Open-Ear AI Translation Earbuds, showcased at CES 2026, offer users a unique blend of audio entertainment, real-world awareness, and advanced language translation technology. Priced at $139.99 (down from a $179.99 MSRP), these earbuds feature an open-ear design that allows users to hear their surroundings while simultaneously listening to music, taking calls, or translating real-time conversations. The standout feature is their built-in AI, which supports translation in over 50 languages across live conversations, phone calls, and spoken audio‚Äîideal for travel, work, or multilingual environments. Beyond translation, the earbuds function as typical audio accessories with a sleek, lightweight, and water-resistant design. With up to 35 hours of battery life using the charging case and hands-free controls, they offer a user-friendly and futuristic audio solution without added complexity.

entries.title: Google Translate brings real-time speech translations to any headphones
entries.snippet:
Google Translate has introduced a major update allowing live speech translations on all headphones, not just Google's Pixel Buds. Available in beta starting today, the feature supports over 70 languages and requires only a compatible Android phone with the Translate app‚Äîunlike Apple‚Äôs version, which is limited to AirPods. This expansion marks a shift towards broader accessibility for real-time translation.

Additionally, Google Translate is improving text translations with the help of its Gemini AI, which enhances the accuracy of idioms and slang, offering more natural interpretations of phrases like ‚Äústealing my thunder.‚Äù The update also expands the Practice feature‚Äîsimilar to Duolingo‚Äîto 20 more countries and supports more languages. This interactive learning tool provides personalized sessions that adapt to users‚Äô language levels.

The live translation update is rolling out on Android in the US, Mexico, and India, with an iOS version expected next year. Enhanced text translations are also now available on both Android and iOS, as well as the web. The Practice feature remains in beta and may be limited to some users.

entries.title: Beelinguapp
Google translate now available as default app for iPhone and iPad users
entries.snippet: As of May 20, 2025, Google Translate has become available as a default app option on iPhone and iPad devices. This integration allows Apple users to access Google's robust translation features‚Äîsuch as text, conversation, and image translation‚Äîdirectly from their devices without needing to launch the standalone Google Translate app. The update enhances user convenience by embedding translation functionality more deeply within the iOS ecosystem.

entries.title: WhatsApp users have been begging for message translations for two long years - and now it's finally here
entries.snippet:
WhatsApp has officially launched its long-awaited message translation feature for Android and iPhone users. Announced by Meta through a blog post, this new tool allows users to translate incoming messages into their preferred language by long-pressing a message and selecting the 'Translate' option. Languages can be downloaded for offline use, and the feature works in group chats and channel updates, not just one-on-one conversations. Importantly, all translations occur on-device, enhancing user privacy.

Initially, the feature supports over 19 languages on iPhone, while Android starts with six languages: English, Spanish, Hindi, Portuguese, Russian, and Arabic. However, Android users gain a unique advantage with exclusive thread translation, which enables automatic, ongoing translation of entire conversations ‚Äî a convenience not available on iPhones.

This update marks a significant improvement for the platform, addressing user demands that have persisted for over two years. Before now, users relied on third-party apps to translate messages. Meta anticipates that the new feature will help eliminate language barriers and foster deeper global connections through the app. Though small in scope now, the translation capability is expected to expand over time.

entries.title: Seed LiveInterpret 2.0: End-to-end Simultaneous Speech-to-speech Translation with Your Voice
Meta rolls out AI voice translation feature on Facebook and Instagram
entries.snippet: Meta has launched a new AI-powered voice translation feature that is now accessible to all users globally on Facebook and Instagram. This innovative tool enables real-time translation of spoken language in voice messages and audio content, significantly enhancing communication between users who speak different languages. The rollout of this feature aligns with Meta's broader efforts to integrate advanced AI technologies into its platforms to foster user connectivity and bridge language barriers. This development marks a major step in Meta‚Äôs ongoing drive to make its social media platforms more inclusive and accessible.

entries.title: Review: InnAIO T10 AI Translator
entries.snippet:
The InnAIO T10 AI Translator introduces a new form factor for translation hardware: a compact, Bluetooth-connected disc that clips magnetically to your phone and works with an accompanying app for real-time translations. Supporting over 150 languages, it includes features like two-way real-time text and audio translations, cross-app messaging support, and a unique Meeting function that summarizes discussions and creates mind maps. It also offers a voice cloning tool that replicates the user‚Äôs voice with impressive fidelity.

While the device is innovative, issues persist: it requires a constant internet connection (offline mode not yet activated), the app has a clunky interface with poor translations, and features like phone call translation are unreliable. Furthermore, after 180 days of use, users must subscribe to paid plans ($14‚Äì$25/month) for full functionality. Users without a subscription are limited to basic features and restricted real-time use. The T10 does boast long battery life and unique features not commonly found in smartphones or competing devices, but its unfinished software and aggressive subscription model make it a tough sell in its current form.

entries.title: Save $67 on these translator earbuds that help you talk in 37 different languages
entries.snippet: The article highlights a limited-time sale on the Mymanu CLIK S translation earbuds, which are currently available for $89.97, down from their regular price of $157‚Äîa 42% discount valid through April 21. These award-winning earbuds, showcased at CES, enable real-time voice translation in 37 languages through the MyJuno app, making them ideal for travelers needing help with communication abroad. Users can either type or speak their question, and the app will translate and vocalize it for locals, while also converting responses back into English. Beyond translation, the earbuds offer up to 30 hours of combined battery life, water resistance, and can also be used for music and calls. They are compatible with voice assistants on both iPhone and Android devices.
